task.title: MSI Interface Protocol
task.shortdesc: The MSI interface protocol is a simple synchronous request/acknowledge handshake. This interface enables the application to request the core to send an MSI interrupt.

context.p: Find below the procedure of sending the MSI interrupt using the MSI interface:

step.cmd: The MSI interface is only used for upstream ports.
ven_msi_req stays asserted until the core asserts ven_msi_grant
The MSI is requested by the application logic through the MSI interface.
The memory write is then generated by the core.
ven_msi_grant is one-cycle pulse acknowledging ven_msi_req
ven_msi_req is not required to be de-asserted before reasserting again.
When ven_msi_req remains asserted, the core generates another MSI.
